abstract: The number of announced European deals fell 43 percent, to $221 billion, in the first six months of 2013, and M.&.A. advisers have been left scratching their heads over how to get deals done.
snippet: The number of announced European deals fell 43 percent, to $221 billion, in the first six months of 2013, and M.&.A. advisers have been left scratching their heads over how to get deals done.
lead_paragraph: LONDON – Sitting in a conference room in JPMorgan Chase’s plush offices in London’s financial district, Hernan Cristerna is in a reflective mood.

headline.main: Deal Outlook in Europe Remains Gloomy
